Notes.Text:
This update for quagga fixes the following issues:

  - CVE-2023-38802: Fixed bad length handling in BGP attribute handling (bsc#1213284).
  - CVE-2023-41358: Fixed possible crash when processing NLRIs if the attribute length is zero (bsc#1214735).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: FRRouting FRR 7.5.1 through 9.0 and Pica8 PICOS 4.3.3.2 allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted BGP update with a corrupted attribute 23 (Tunnel Encapsulation).

Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in FRRouting FRR through 9.0. bgpd/bgp_packet.c processes NLRIs if the attribute length is zero.
